image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Ohio and 25th President of the United States; born in Niles, Ohio, January 29, 1843; attended the public schools, Poland Academy, and Allegheny College; teacher; served in the Union Army, Ohio Volunteer Infantry, 1861-1865; lawyer, private practice; prosecuting attorney of Stark County, Ohio, 1869-1871; elected as a Republican to the Forty-fifth and to the two succeeding Congresses (March 4, 1877-March 3, 1883); chair, Committee on Revision of the Laws (Forty-seventh Congress); presented credentials as a Member-elect to the Forty-eighth Congress and served from March 4, 1883, until May 27, 1884, when he was succeeded by Jonathan H. Wallace, who successfully contested his election; again elected to the Forty-ninth and to the two succeeding Congresses (March 4, 1885-March 3, 1891); chair, Committee on Ways and Means (Fifty-first Congress); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1890 to the Fifty-second Congress; delegate to the Republican National Conventions in 1884, 1888, and 1892; Governor of Ohio 1891-1896; President of the United States 1897-1901; shot by an assassin in Buffalo, N.Y., on September 6, 1901; died in Buffalo, N.Y., on September 14, 1901; lay in state in the Rotunda of the U.S. Capitol, September 17, 1901; interment in the McKinley Monument (adjacent to West Lawn Cemetery), Canton, Ohio.

researchRecord.name: 1 volume of letters (n.d.) in the Nicholas Murray Butler papers.
1847-1902. 424 containers.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence, speeches, messages, scrapbooks, and some records kept at the time of his assassination. Published index. Also on microfilm (98 reels).

researchRecord.name: Official correspondence (May 16, 1893; January 23, 1895), letter (1898?), and engraved portrait (n.d.).
1850-1917. ca. 7 feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence, speeches, financial papers, clippings, and photographs relating to his political career and military service. Unpublished register in repository.

researchRecord.name: In Myron Timothy Herrick papers, ca. 1827-1935. ca. 17 feet.
researchRecord.description: Includes correspondence (1889-1906) from Ida and William McKinley. Unpublished register in library. Restricted.

researchRecord.name: Correspondence in the John Sherman papers, 1839-1921. 46 items.
Records and papers regarding his law practice in Navarre, beginning 1869.
1892-1896. ca. 3 feet.
researchRecord.description: Gubernatorial papers and correspondence. Inventory in repository.

researchRecord.name: 1898-1902. 1 1/2 feet.
researchRecord.description: Copies of originals in Rutherford B. Hayes Library.
